list_definition.definition: an area in a desert where water is found

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The travellers/travelers stopped at an oasis.

list_ex_of_english: I agree there is a certain measure of harshness in its operation, but it is almost inevitable in some oases.
I have known oases in my own experience where the chairman's recommendation has been entirely ignored and overruled.
In all these oases, there should be a follow-up to find out precisely why there was inadequate attention in the hospital concerned.
Quite a number of these oases remain to be considered, and it is invidious that they should be singled out for neglect.
Mechanical restraint, padded rooms and so on, are hardly employed at all, except in oases of quite dire necessity where it is a compulsion.
What they strike at in many oases is the distribution of particular functions.
In these parks are green oases where those who wish for rest and quiet and repose can enjoy themselves.
What we want to do is to enable these oases to be reviewed.
